node.title: What took so long? Hostess offers caffeinated donuts
node.description: The company behind Twinkies and other sweet snacks adds the equivalent of a cup of coffee to its latest concoction.
node.content: ["America, rejoice: Getting that morning jolt of caffeine and sugar can now be done in a single bite.\u00a0", "After more than 80 years in the donut business, Hostess Brands is rolling out caffeinated Hostess Boost Jumbo Donettes this month at stores nationwide, the Lenexa, Kansas company said in a news\u00a0release.\u00a0", "Packing 300 calories, and three times bigger than the company's original mini donuts, the latest additions to the Hostess lineup contain slightly less caffeine \u201450 to 70 milligrams \u2014 than one cup of java.\u00a0", "An eight-ounce cup of coffee holds closer to 80 to 100 milligrams of caffeine, while\u00a0caffeine in energy drinks can range from 40 to 250 milligrams for every eight ounces, according to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.\u00a0", "The single-serve caffeinated donuts come in two varieties \u2014 Chocolate Mocha and Caramel Macchiato \u2014 with a suggested retail price of $2.49.", "The lightly glazed caffeinated treats are geared to \"adults who are increasingly looking for alternative sources of caffeine,\" according to Christopher Balach, general manager of Hostess.\u00a0", "In recent years, that's included beef jerky\u00a0and sunflower seeds. ", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
